alert.note: Alert for Barron; Polk (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 7:03PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Barron and northeastern Polk Counties through 745 PM CDT... At 703 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Luck, or 29 miles southwest of Spooner, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Barron and northeastern Polk Counties, including the following locations... Mckinley and Straight Lake Wilderness State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northwestern Wisconsin.
